title: align_query_reference
description:
Alignment of a query and reference dataset by:
* Alignment of layers
* Harmonization of .obs field names for batch and cell type labels
* Harmonization of .var field name for gene names
* Sanitation of gene names
* Cross-checking of genes
* Assignment of an id to the query and reference datasets

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input (query) data to be labeled
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input (query) data to be labeled. Should be a .h5mu file.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process. Note that the query and reference modalities should be the same.

input_layer.description: Type: `string`. The layer in the input (query) data to be used for cell type annotation if
input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. The layer in the input (query) data to be used for cell type annotation if .X is not to be used.

input_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the .var column in the input (query) data containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used.

input_obs_batch.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample_id`. The name of the
input_obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample_id`. The name of the .obs column in the input (query) data containing batch information.

input_obs_label.description: Type: `string`, example: `cell_type`. The name of the
input_obs_label.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `cell_type`. The name of the .obs column in the input (query) data containing cell type labels. If not provided, the --unkown_celltype_label will be assigned to all observations.

input_id.description: Type: `string`, default: `query`. Meta id value to be assigned to the --output_obs_id
input_id.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `query`. Meta id value to be assigned to the --output_obs_id .obs field of the aligned input (query) data.

output_query.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_query.h5mu`, example: `output_query.h5mu`. Aligned query data
output_query.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_query.h5mu`, example: `output_query.h5mu`. Aligned query data.

output_reference.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_reference.h5mu`, example: `output_reference.h5mu`. Aligned reference data
output_reference.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output_reference.h5mu`, example: `output_reference.h5mu`. Aligned reference data.

output_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `_counts`. Name of the aligned layer in the output query and reference datasets
output_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `_counts`. Name of the aligned layer in the output query and reference datasets.

output_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `_gene_names`. Name of the .var column in the output query and reference datasets containing the gene names.

output_obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `_sample_id`. Name of the .obs column in the output query and reference datasets containing the batch information.

output_obs_label.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `_cell_type`. Name of the .obs column in the output query and reference datasets containing the cell type labels.

output_obs_id.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `_dataset`. Name of the .obs column in the output query and reference datasets containing the dataset id.

output_var_index.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `ori_var_index`. Name of the .var column to which the .var index of the --input and --reference datasets is stored. Only relevant if "--preserve_var_index" is False.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Arguments related to the alignment of the input and reference datasets.

input_reference_gene_overlap.description: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. The minimum number of genes present in both the reference and query datasets
input_reference_gene_overlap.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `100`. The minimum number of genes present in both the reference and query datasets.

unkown_celltype_label.description: Type: `string`, default: `Unknown`. The label to assign to cells with an unknown cell type
unkown_celltype_label.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `Unknown`. The label to assign to cells with an unknown cell type.

overwrite_existing_key.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If set to true and the layer, obs or var key already exists in the query/reference file, the key will be overwritten
overwrite_existing_key.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If set to true and the layer, obs or var key already exists in the query/reference file, the key will be overwritten.

preserve_var_index.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If set to true, the
preserve_var_index.help_text:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If set to true, the .var index of the --input and --reference datasets will be preserved.
If set to false (default behavior), the original .var index will be stored in the --output_var_index .var column and the .var index will be replaced with the sanitized & aligned gene names.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: Arguments related to the reference dataset.
Type: `file`, example: `reference.h5mu`. The reference data to train the CellTypist classifiers on
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `reference.h5mu`. The reference data to train the CellTypist classifiers on. Only required if a pre-trained --model is not provided.

reference_layer.description: Type: `string`. The layer in the reference data to be used for cell type annotation if
reference_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. The layer in the reference data to be used for cell type annotation if .X is not to be used. Data are expected to be processed in the same way as the --input query dataset.

reference_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The name of the .var column in the reference data containing gene names; when no gene_name_layer is provided, the var index will be used.

reference_obs_batch.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample_id`. The name of the
reference_obs_batch.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample_id`. The name of the .obs column in the reference data containing batch information.

reference_obs_label.description: Type: `string`, example: `cell_type`. The name of the
reference_obs_label.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `cell_type`. The name of the .obs column in the reference data containing cell type labels. If not provided, the --unkown_celltype_label will be assigned to all observations.

reference_id.description: Type: `string`, default: `reference`. Meta id value to be assigned to the --output_obs_id
reference_id.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `reference`. Meta id value to be assigned to the --output_obs_id .obs field of the aligned reference data.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
